page.title: 03Transport Past and Present
page.content: In the last century and before, people lived on the{moors}rather than the valley and this can be proved by the farm and handloom weaving settlements and the ancient pack roads still to be found.One such is the{Reddyshore Scout which was one of the first paved roads in our district. In 1790 came the toll road.This toll road is now the secondary Calder- brook road.Then another toll road was built in 1824 -this is the modern {A6033}from{Littleborough}to{Todmorden In 1790 the{canal}was also constructed but, as a form of transport, died out in the 1920's.The{railway,}which was constructed in 1840, took most of the canal's customers.The railway is still running through our valley today.We can use it to get to Manchester and Leeds -and then onwards.
